question_text: What do plants need to grow?
explanation: Plants need sunlight water air and nutrients from soil to grow properly.

question_text: Which part of the plant takes in water?
explanation: Roots absorb water and nutrients from the soil.

question_text: What do leaves do for a plant?
explanation: Leaves make food for the plant through photosynthesis.

question_text: What is the green color in leaves called?
explanation: Chlorophyll is the green substance that helps plants make food.

question_text: What gas do plants take in from the air?
explanation: Plants take in carbon dioxide from the air during photosynthesis.

question_text: What gas do plants give out?
explanation: Plants give out oxygen as a result of photosynthesis.

question_text: Which part carries water from roots to leaves?
explanation: The stem carries water and nutrients from roots to other parts of the plant.

question_text: What is it called when plants make their own food?
explanation: Photosynthesis is the process where plants make food using sunlight.

question_text: Why are plants important to us?
explanation: Plants give us oxygen food and many useful materials.
choice_c: They give us oxygen and food

question_text: What happens if a plant doesn't get enough sunlight?
explanation: Without enough sunlight plants cannot make food and may die.
choice_b: It becomes weak and may die

question_text: What do all animals need to stay alive?
explanation: All animals need food water air and shelter to survive.

question_text: Which animals eat only plants?
explanation: Herbivores are animals that eat only plants.

question_text: Which animals eat only meat?
explanation: Carnivores are animals that eat only meat.

question_text: Which animals eat both plants and meat?
explanation: Omnivores eat both plants and animals.

question_text: How do fish get oxygen?
explanation: Fish use gills to get oxygen from water.

question_text: What do we call animals that are eaten by other animals?
explanation: Prey are animals that are hunted and eaten by predators.

question_text: What do we call animals that hunt other animals?
explanation: Predators are animals that hunt and eat other animals.

question_text: How do most birds move from place to place?
explanation: Most birds use their wings to fly.

question_text: What covers the body of most mammals?
explanation: Most mammals have fur or hair on their bodies.

question_text: How do mammals feed their babies?
explanation: Mammals produce milk to feed their young.

question_text: How many main senses do we have?
explanation: We have five main senses: sight hearing smell taste and touch.

question_text: Which body part do we use to see?
explanation: We use our eyes to see things around us.

question_text: Which body part do we use to hear?
explanation: We use our ears to hear sounds.

question_text: Which body part do we use to smell?
explanation: We use our nose to smell different things.

question_text: Which body part do we use to taste?
explanation: We use our mouth and tongue to taste food.

question_text: What do we use our skin for?
explanation: Our skin helps us feel and touch things.

question_text: What does the heart do?
explanation: The heart pumps blood around our body.

question_text: What do the lungs do?
explanation: The lungs help us breathe air.

question_text: What does the brain do?
explanation: The brain controls our thinking and body movements.

question_text: What do bones do for our body?
explanation: Bones give our body shape and support.

question_text: Why should we wash our hands?
explanation: Washing hands removes germs and keeps us healthy.
choice_c: To remove germs and stay healthy

question_text: How often should we brush our teeth?
explanation: We should brush our teeth at least twice a day.

question_text: Why should we eat fruits and vegetables?
explanation: Fruits and vegetables give us vitamins and keep us healthy.
choice_d: They give us vitamins and keep us healthy

question_text: What should we do before eating?
explanation: We should wash our hands before eating to remove germs.

question_text: Why do we need to sleep?
explanation: Sleep helps our body rest and grow.

question_text: What happens if we don't drink enough water?
explanation: Not drinking enough water makes us sick and weak.

question_text: Why should we exercise?
explanation: Exercise keeps our body strong and healthy.
choice_d: To keep our body strong and healthy

question_text: What should we do when we cough or sneeze?
explanation: We should cover our mouth and nose to stop germs spreading.

question_text: Why should we keep our surroundings clean?
explanation: Clean surroundings prevent diseases and keep us healthy.
choice_a: To prevent diseases and stay healthy

question_text: What should we wear to protect our feet?
explanation: We should wear shoes to protect our feet from dirt and injury.

question_text: What are the three main states of matter?
explanation: The three states of matter are solid liquid and gas.

question_text: What happens to water when it gets very cold?
explanation: When water gets very cold it becomes ice (solid).

question_text: What happens to water when it gets very hot?
explanation: When water gets very hot it becomes steam (gas).

question_text: Which of these is a solid?
explanation: A stone is solid because it keeps its shape.

question_text: Which of these is a liquid?
explanation: Water is liquid because it flows and takes the shape of its container.

question_text: Which of these is a gas?
explanation: Air is gas because we cannot see it but we can feel it.

question_text: What happens to things when they get hot?
explanation: Most things get bigger (expand) when they get hot.

question_text: What happens to things when they get cold?
explanation: Most things get smaller (contract) when they get cold.

question_text: Which material is attracted to a magnet?
explanation: Iron and steel are attracted to magnets.

question_text: Which material does not let electricity pass through easily?
explanation: Rubber does not let electricity pass through easily making it safe.

question_text: What is a force?
explanation: A force is a push or pull that can make things move.

question_text: What happens when you push a toy car?
explanation: Pushing a toy car makes it move forward.

question_text: What force pulls things down to the ground?
explanation: Gravity is the force that pulls everything toward the Earth.

question_text: What happens when you drop a ball?
explanation: When you drop a ball gravity pulls it down to the ground.

question_text: Why is it harder to push a heavy box than a light box?
explanation: Heavy things need more force to move them.

question_text: What slows down a rolling ball?
explanation: Friction between the ball and ground slows it down.

question_text: What do we call the force that stops things from moving easily?
explanation: Friction is the force that makes it hard for things to slide or roll.

question_text: What happens when you stop pushing a moving toy?
explanation: When you stop pushing friction makes the toy slow down and stop.

question_text: Which surface would a ball roll further on?
explanation: A ball rolls further on smooth surfaces because there is less friction.

question_text: What makes a bicycle move?
explanation: Pedaling applies force that makes the bicycle move.

question_text: What do we need to see things?
explanation: We need light to see things around us.

question_text: What happens when light hits a mirror?
explanation: Light bounces back when it hits a mirror.

question_text: Which object makes its own light?
explanation: The sun makes its own light unlike the moon which reflects light.

question_text: What is the dark area behind an object when light shines on it?
explanation: A shadow is formed when an object blocks light.

question_text: How is sound made?
explanation: Sound is made when things vibrate or shake.

question_text: What do we use to hear sounds?
explanation: We use our ears to hear sounds.

question_text: Which travels faster light or sound?
explanation: Light travels much faster than sound.

question_text: What makes different sounds?
explanation: Different things vibrating in different ways make different sounds.

question_text: Why can we see ourselves in a mirror?
explanation: Light bounces off us and then bounces back from the mirror to our eyes.
choice_b: Light bounces off us and back from mirror

question_text: Can sound travel through empty space?
explanation: Sound cannot travel through empty space because it needs air or other materials.

question_text: What causes day and night?
explanation: Day and night happen because the Earth spins around.

question_text: When is it usually hottest during the day?
explanation: It is usually hottest around midday when the sun is highest.

question_text: What do we call water that falls from clouds?
explanation: Rain is water that falls from clouds.

question_text: What happens to water when the sun shines on it?
explanation: Water evaporates (turns into water vapor) when the sun heats it.

question_text: What are clouds made of?
explanation: Clouds are made of tiny water droplets floating in the air.

question_text: Which season comes after summer?
explanation: Autumn (fall) comes after summer.

question_text: What do we use to measure how hot or cold it is?
explanation: We use a thermometer to measure temperature.

question_text: What causes wind?
explanation: Wind is caused by air moving from one place to another.

question_text: What do we call a very strong wind?
explanation: A storm has very strong winds that can be dangerous.

question_text: Why do we have different seasons?
explanation: We have different seasons because the Earth tilts as it goes around the sun.
choice_c: Earth tilts as it goes around sun

question_text: What is a simple tool?
explanation: A simple tool is something that makes work easier for us.

question_text: Which of these is an example of a lever?
explanation: A seesaw is a lever that helps lift things.

question_text: What is a ramp used for?
explanation: A ramp makes it easier to move things to higher places.
choice_d: To move things to higher places

question_text: What simple tool is used to lift a flag?
explanation: A pulley is used to lift flags up flagpoles.

question_text: Which simple tool is a knife?
explanation: A knife is a wedge that cuts by being thin and sharp.

question_text: What simple tool is found on a bicycle?
explanation: A bicycle has wheels that help it move.

question_text: How do simple tools help us?
explanation: Simple tools make our work easier and faster.

question_text: What is the turning point of a seesaw called?
explanation: The fulcrum is the point where a seesaw balances and turns.

question_text: Which simple tool would help you move a heavy box up to a truck?
explanation: A ramp (inclined plane) makes it easier to move heavy things up.

question_text: What simple tool is a bottle opener?
explanation: A bottle opener is a type of lever that helps remove bottle caps.
